body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY! 

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line: 
>
/kind bug
> /kind feature


**What happened**:
run hack/local-up-cluster.sh
apiserver start failed. with message no default route.

**What you expected to happen**:
start a local kubernetes cluster successfully.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
run hack/local-up-cluster.sh or run hack/local-up-cluster.sh -O

**Anything else we need to know?**:
I suppose it is a bug.

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):

Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"8+", GitVersion:"v1.8.0-alpha.2.904+37215e67b8d490", GitCommit:"37215e67b8d4909a4f48faa19a3f2e97dc7565a9", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-07-27T16:56:18Z", GoVersion:"go1.8.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"8+", GitVersion:"v1.8.0-alpha.2.904+37215e67b8d490", GitCommit:"37215e67b8d4909a4f48faa19a3f2e97dc7565a9", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-07-27T16:56:18Z", GoVersion:"go1.8.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}

- Cloud provider or hardware configuration**:
no use

- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
NAME="CentOS Linux"
VERSION="7 (Core)"
ID="centos"
ID_LIKE="rhel fedora"
VERSION_ID="7"
PRETTY_NAME="CentOS Linux 7 (Core)"
ANSI_COLOR="0;31"
CPE_NAME="cpe:/o:centos:centos:7"
HOME_URL="https://www.centos.org/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.centos.org/"

CENTOS_MANTISBT_PROJECT="CentOS-7"
CENTOS_MANTISBT_PROJECT_VERSION="7"
REDHAT_SUPPORT_PRODUCT="centos"
REDHAT_SUPPORT_PRODUCT_VERSION="7"

- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
3.10.0-327.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Thu Nov 19 22:10:57 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

- Install tools:
from source
- Others:
run local-up-cluster.sh in an intranet environment, with no internet connections.

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Indicates an issue or PR lacks a `sig/foo` label and requires one.
labels.name: needs-sig

title: local-up-cluster.sh run failed without apiserver listening
